children.subject: Plus, on the Applied math course requirements page, it says 16A and 16B are accepted only for double majors in CS and math, so keep this in mind too and consider whether it would even count for you to take 16A.

Thanks a lot , I want to go into a SWE job, but I like robotics also. Is robotics related to EE16A and EE16B?  I probably should take math 55 then, because math 54 I already have taken in community college.

                                                           Thanks!
Same anon as above: It also says I wont receive any credit for math 55 if I have taken cs70? So do u have any suggestion what class to take?

Not a robotics person so someone who is can confirm; but if you like robotics, you would probably want to do at least EE C106A (Intro. to Robotics), or EE 120 (Signals and Systems) which may count as an Applied Math electives. For these you'll want to have completed 16B, so then I wouldn't advise doing 54 if you go down this route. Definitely take 61B as this is essential for SWE classes and internships, and it's also a pretty great class. 

You may want to take 16A and 16B in any case just to see if you still even like EE and robotics, because they give you an intro into a lot of different EE and ML related material, which are relevant for robotics. It sounds like your proposed schedule fits your interests, so I'd say go for it if it doesn't seem like it'll be too much work. Keep in mind EE16A and 16B take lots of time per week due to p-sets and labs, and 61B has rather hefty projects. I haven't taken Math 110 but it's required for you and Lin. Alg. is definitely relevant for most EECS topics, so you'd probably want to take it as well. Best of luck!

Unless you still really want to learn some EE-related stuff despite your declaration situation, I would maybe advise you to do Math 54 instead of 16A, since thats a required class for Applied Math. Otherwise, you'd have to do both 16A and 16B, and this seems like *a lot* more work (Math dept. maybe just accepts these courses for those who already took these but couldn't get into the cs major). Math 110 would overlap a lot with 54, so you may want to take it afterward, maybe next semester. 

Maybe elaborate more on your situation? The course load doesn't seem too bad; and it seems like you still want to go into a CS-related career (judging by your wanting to take 61B and 16A). If this is the case, if you want to go into a SWE job, I'd say maybe just have 61B as your EECS course and take math classes with it. Or if you want to do a EE job, take 16A and 16B instead of 54 and maybe don't do 61B.

history.content:
Hi, 

        I am taking math 110, EE16A ,CS61B. How is this course load? I cant declare cs (if if get A in cs61B I still will have a gpa of 3.233) , so now I am declaring Applied mathematics. Any suggestions or how does this course load sound . Also maybe I will do some research in spring.

                                                                 Thank you!
history.subject: Course Load SP 20
